page.title: 20Sainsbury Depot,Buntingford
page.content: In the 1950s, J. Sainsbury's grocery chain moved its distribution depot from Blackfriars to Buntingford.In 1968 the company built a large warehouse, housing-estates to accomodate workers moving from London, and extensive sports and leisure facilities. By 1985 the "overspill" population has quite assimilated the local way of life. The depot serves Sainsbury stores throughout East Anglia, the East Midlands and North London. It employs about 700 people and runs a fleet of 100 lorries. Suppliers deliver their goods to Buntingford, for redistribution. A computerised system sends each store's needs to Head Office every evening. The information is transmitted to the depots, loads are made up and the stores are resupplied by next morning.
